org.eclipse.papyrus.designer.components.transformation.templates

Class ConnectorBinding

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.papyrus.designer.components.transformation.templates.ConnectorBinding

  • public class ConnectorBinding
extends Object
    Create an automatic template binding for a connector, i.e. a binding that assures that the ports of an interaction component match those of an application component (if possible)

      This function tries to bind a formal template parameter to an "actual".

    • Method Detail

      • getActual

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Type getActual(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Feature partOrConnector,
                                                  org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Class template,
                                                  org.eclipse.uml2.uml.ParameterableElement formal)
                                           throws TransformationException
        This function tries to bind a formal template parameter to an "actual". The criterion for a successful binding is that the (primitive) connections of the reified connector part have a matching port kind. The function makes a matching based on (1) either provided and required interfaces (2) or identical portKinds and different conjugations
        Parameters:
        composite - The composite in which a binding should be determined.
        part - the part within the composite for which we try to find a binding, The information about the part is used to determine which connection end belongs to the template part and which to another part/port (which determines the binding).
        template - A template class
        formal - the formal template parameter
        Returns:
        the actual
        Throws:
        TransformationException - if no consistent binding can be found

      • createErrorMsg

        protected static String createErrorMsg(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Port port,
                                       org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Feature partOrConnector)

      • obtainBinding

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.TemplateBinding obtainBinding(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Class composite,
                                                                 org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Feature connector,
                                                                 org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Class template,
                                                                 boolean createBinding)
                                                          throws TransformationException
        The objective of this function is to find a suitable binding for a part typed with a template class (connector) based compatible port types. The binding is obtained by examining the connections between the composite and the contained part.
        Parameters:
        composite - the composite which owns the part
        containedPart - the part which represents the connector
        template - an element within a package template (might be deeply nested) which has ports that depend on a template parameter. This method tries to find a binding for the template parameters that renders the ports of this element compatible with the ports of the composition context.
        Returns:
        the bound package ? binding information, i.e. information about the bound package, whether already bound and the binding.
        Throws:
        TransformationException
